result.execSummary:
The defendant David Arnold Belille Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Arnold Belille in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant David Arnold Belille in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State addresses court. Argues for 6 months consecutive to 6 months in 15CM272. 
Atty Moldenhauer argues sentence. Def addresses court. Court addresses def. 
Court imposes:  6 months county jail with Huber priviledges. Must comply with all Huber requirements. Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Credit for good time and time served of 145 days. 36 days of the total of 171 to roll-over to 15CF116. Judgment to be taken on costs.

Defendant David Arnold Belille in court without an attorney.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DEF states he wants to represent himself. Court addresses DEF. 
SAR postponed to give time for def to contact Public Defender's office.  Sentence adjustment review scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

AMENDED
Emailed to Attys and Judge Harrington
Sentence adjustment review on October 31, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
to Modify condiitons of probation - add 30 days jail with out huber

Defendant David Arnold Belille in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts, DEF pleads NC to CT#1 found guilty, Court withholds sentence 2 years probation  consecutive to 15cm99 -  conditions of probation fine/costs $642.00 no contact with Whitney Davis, Nicole Beaulieu, Tiffany Billyboy, Justin Picchietti  or Marissa Wade,   complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent

Defendant David Arnold Belille in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OFF the record.  Atty Jarvis states DEF wants new counsel.  Court wants a motion or preferably a stipulation filed.  DEF must have new counsel before Jarvis is released.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 11:30 am.
